Text:
Democrats passed the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act to deliver results #ForThePeople. This funding is a key step to ease supply chain congestion and lower prices for American consumers, making it easier for businesses to bring goods to the market.
https://t.co/rIUVe3M8zn
Join me live at the U.S. Capitol for my weekly press conference. https://t.co/8DbHvNWOMe

Today, we met with @Keir_Starmer & other Members of Parliament. We discussed the transatlantic response to the situation in Ukraine, COVID-19 response & recovery, increasing economic prosperity people in the US & the UK & transitioning to diversified green energy solutions. https://t.co/qggowRuyey

Following our meetings in Israel, Germany & the United Kingdom, we return with confidence in our partnerships abroad & inspired to continue working to strengthen security, economy & democratic governance for people around the world. Read my full statement: https://t.co/9oLcJaBciu

As part of our visit, our delegation also met with a dedicated and courageous group of activists for human rights in China, recognizing the threat posed by the Chinese Communist Party’s decades-long campaign of repression against the Chinese people.

During our visit to London, President Putin further escalated his aggression against Ukraine. I applaud @POTUS for his forceful leadership today in imposing the first tranche of swift and severe sanctions.

Our delegation also held additional bilateral meetings with senior British leaders @TrussLiz & @Keir_Starmer to discuss the importance of the NATO alliance & transatlantic partnership, the COVID-19 response & the imperative of transitioning to diversified green energy solutions.

Yesterday, @CommonsSpeaker extended to our delegation the privilege of an official welcome to @HouseOfCommons & a ceremonial luncheon with senior Members of Parliament. We also met with @BorisJohnson & discussed the determination of allied nations to counter Russian aggression.

Our Congressional delegation came to the United Kingdom to reaffirm our nations’ enduring relationship & to deepen the bonds between parliaments. In our discussions, we expressed how the relationship remains crucial in the fight against anti-democratic forces around the globe.

In this challenging moment, the special relationship between our nations will remain crucial. The United States and the United Kingdom must continue to work together to unify our NATO allies, ensure security and promote democracy. Read my statement here:
https://t.co/vhvnUdiEnD

Our Congressional delegation today held a bilateral meeting with @BorisJohnson. The discussion focused on Russia’s ongoing aggression against Ukraine, which poses a threat to the people of the Ukraine, to security and stability in Europe & to democratic values around the world.

On behalf of the Congress, I look forward to reciprocating Speaker Hoyle’s hospitality by welcoming him to the United States Capitol soon. Read my full statement here:
https://t.co/pThTbBsmxP

In our meeting with Speaker Hoyle, we discussed the perilous situation in Ukraine and how we can continue our work together to strengthen the transatlantic alliance as we advance our mutual security, common economic interests and shared democratic values.

Today, our Congressional delegation had the great privilege of visiting the British House of Commons. We thank @CommonsSpeaker for his official welcome to our delegation, which included an official lunch and welcome to the Chamber of the House of Commons.

Our Congressional delegation was honored to be welcomed to the British House of Commons today. When I signed the chamber’s guest book, I paid tribute to the strong bond between our Houses and conveyed America’s enduring commitment to the special relationship between our nations. https://t.co/GaKBYVECrm

The ties between the U.S. House of Representatives & the British House of Commons are historic, strong & enduring. Thank you @CommonsSpeaker Lindsay Hoyle for your gracious & generous hospitality & strong leadership to advance mutual security, economic interests & shared values. https://t.co/kQZR5VidP0

As a longtime leader in fighting the PRC's human right abuses, it was a privilege to meet with @NathanLawkc, @MahmutRahima & @AngelaGui_, fighters for freedom, human rights & the rule of law. 

Congress’ commitment to human rights in China is bipartisan, bicameral & lasting. https://t.co/9DvY7RCmtn

One of our delegation’s first stops in London was to greet our U.S. Marine Detachment at @USAinUK. It was our honor to bring the gratitude of the Congress to our heroes in uniform for their patriotic service to our nation. https://t.co/eTbfr5uPYA
Read my full statement on the conclusion of the Congressional Delegation visit to #MSC2022 here: https://t.co/eD6pFVkcjE

We also met with European partners @OlafScholz, @JensStoltenberg, @vonderLeyen and @Vitaliy_Klychko and heard remarks by @ZelenskyyUa. We expressed America’s commitment to NATO and the transatlantic alliance, support for the people of Ukraine and opposition to Russian aggression.

Our delegation met with key American leaders @SecBlinken, @US_EUCOM Commander Tod Wolters, @USAfricaCommand Commander Stephen Townsend, @USAmbNATO & the U.S. Country Team, led by Ambassador Amy Gutmann. We discussed our national security & commitment to diplomacy first.

In the interest of our national security, economic strength & democratic values, our Congressional delegation came to the @MunSecConf to deliver a message that the U.S. remains unwavering in our commitment to NATO, the transatlantic partnership & mutual security.

NATO Secretary General @jensstoltenberg has been a steadfast champion of security & peace. Our delegation was honored to meet with him & @USAmbNATO to discuss the strong transatlantic alliance, strategies to counter Russian aggression & how best to support the Ukrainian people. https://t.co/LZt061NZvj

Our Congressional delegation met with World Health Organization Director-General @DrTedros. We discussed the importance of accountability and transparency related to the COVID-19 pandemic and the importance of equity in the global vaccination distribution effort. https://t.co/ETJo1MB5rk

It was a privilege to meet today with Chancellor @OlafScholz, a stalwart partner for peace and stability in Europe. Our nations share a vital interest in supporting the people of Ukraine and countering Russia’s accelerating aggression. https://t.co/PA1r3sdxOL

Uniting and strengthening the transatlantic alliance is a top priority of Congress and President Biden – and President von der Leyen has been an strategic and essential partner in this effort. https://t.co/FQAUnSShlf
Today, our Congressional delegation was honored to meet with the President of the European Commission @vonderleyen. https://t.co/XYriCWj2I6

It was my privilege to address the Defense Ministers Breakfast this morning, a time-honored tradition at @MunSecConf. We discussed the importance of a strong multilateral and bilateral partnerships to advance our mutual security, common interests and shared values. https://t.co/5VRsXFqxyp
Yesterday, at #MSC2022, we received an update on Ukraine from Secretary of State @SecBlinken and discussed our unyielding commitment to the people of Ukraine. https://t.co/qIvSwyGnP5
Join @RepAdamSchiff, @RepBarbaraLee, @BettyMcCollum04 and me for a press conference at the Munich Security Conference. https://t.co/IElRbGoBNp

Our delegation had the opportunity to meet with Mayor @Vitaliy_Klychko of Kyiv.

He conveyed the concerns of his people in the face of Russian aggression. Our delegation reiterated America’s unwavering support for the people of Ukraine & commitment to the transatlantic alliance. https://t.co/4zEx7dNjdG
At a meeting led by U.S. Ambassador to Germany Amy Gutmann, we discussed the importance of the transatlantic alliance and strengthening our national security. https://t.co/U6TAltvuGD

After our Congressional delegation arrived in Munich, we met with the U.S. Marine detachment at @USConsMunich to proudly deliver the gratitude of the Country and Congress for the service of our men and women in uniform. https://t.co/KtRj996jwY

Join Germany’s Defense Minister Christine Lambrecht, Greece’s Prime Minister @KMitsotakis & me at the Munich Security Conference for a panel discussion moderated by Ivan Krastev on “Stemming the Illiberal Tide: The Global Challenge of Eroding Democracy”. https://t.co/qwKaSbo3D4

Our Congressional delegation met with President Mahmoud Abbas & Prime Minister Shtayyeh. We emphasized our unyielding commitment to advancing the safety & security for all living in the region & the need to pursue a just, enduring two-state solution to benefit all generations. https://t.co/J3ZZYjbw9b

COVID-19 has devastated the Palestinian economy. With a new initiative from @USAID, America will help revitalize local Palestinian businesses – fueling innovation & entrepreneurship, creating more jobs and setting up the Palestinian economy for long-term success. https://t.co/V8bf4kP0xO

Today, our delegation met with Israeli Prime Minister @NaftaliBennett. We discussed the Congress’ firm commitment to Israel’s security and regional stability, as well as our continued hope for a just, enduring two-state solution for Israel, Palestinians and their neighbors. https://t.co/dB6jYG4WMT
Thank you @DanielSeidemann for briefing our Congressional delegation on key geopolitical issues, neighborhoods and flashpoints in Jerusalem. Your insight was very valuable. https://t.co/a87Yp3so6l

Israel's security is an imperative for America's security. Today, our delegation viewed Iron Dome – a defensive system that has helped save thousands of lives. Last year, the House with strong bipartisan support proudly passed H.R. 5323 in further support of Iron Dome. https://t.co/jmwO2UVnly

Thank you, President @Isaac_Herzog, for graciously hosting our delegation at The Presidency. It was a privilege to meet with you and to discuss our nations’ continued partnership on Israel's security and regional stability, COVID, climate and more. https://t.co/cEyeoRcZlZ

Today, our delegation was honored to meet with @YairLapid, Alternate Prime Minister & Minister of Foreign Affairs of the State of Israel. We discussed global security concerns & how our nations can further strengthen Israel’s security & regional stability. https://t.co/Xmf4DJiMn2

Our Congressional delegation had the privilege of visiting the Knesset today to reaffirm & strengthen the bonds between our chambers – built on shared democratic values and mutual security interests. https://t.co/DS6WNk4I7C

Today, Speaker @MKMickeyLevy and I spoke at the Israeli Knesset on the crucial and long-standing relationship between the Knesset and the Congress, built on our mutual security, economic interest, common values and commitment to democracy. https://t.co/TdyXJH4m4D

Honored to meet with Knesset Speaker @MKMickeyLevy & diverse senior Knesset leaders to reaffirm Congress’ bipartisan support for Israel. We discussed our nations’ unbreakable bond to advance security, prosperity, democracy, & our hope for a just, durable two-state solution. https://t.co/auh3qa8DrR

What an honor it was for our Congressional delegation to be welcomed to the Knesset today and to pay tribute to Israel’s fallen soldiers. In signing the Knesset’s guestbook, I conveyed that the Congress’ support for Israel is eternal and ironclad. https://t.co/qh45wHDWsW
Read more about our Congressional delegation to Israel, Germany and the United Kingdom here: https://t.co/gB2qBrr3LS

In London, our delegation will deepen our interparliamentary dialogue on how we can continue to work together to counter antidemocratic forces and advance our shared values and interests in the global arena.

At the Munich Security Conference, our delegation will reaffirm America’s ironclad commitment to the transatlantic partnership, especially in the face of worldwide challenges to democracy and the rise of autocratic threats.

Our first stop will be in Israel, recognizing our shared democratic values and mutual security.  We will meet with the leadership of Israel and leaders in the civic community to discuss the prospects for a two-state solution and regional security.

As threats to democracy grow more alarming and urgent, I am leading a Congressional delegation to Israel, Germany and the United Kingdom to focus on advancing security and stability, economic prosperity and democratic governance around the world.

Millions of Americans know the hardships faced with electrical power outages – which can cost our economy up to $70 billion annually. The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law invests $65 billion in clean energy transmission, to make electrical grids cleaner, stronger & more resilient.

Every child has the fundamental right to reach for their dreams, without fearing for their lives. Let us renew our commitment to ending the horrors of gun violence. Read my full statement here: https://t.co/7lncseoAVg

Now, we must honor their memory and ensure that nobody ever again endures such a tragedy. That is why @HouseDemocrats have taken action to keep weapons out of dangerous hands and spoken out alongside the countless young people who have rallied together to March For Our Lives.

Four years ago, seventeen beautiful souls were murdered in a senseless act of terror at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School — tearing loved ones from their families and robbing a community of students, friends and mentors.

The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act passed by @HouseDemocrats and signed by @POTUS invests $66 billion in rail funding – the largest investment since the creation of Amtrak! This funding will ensure that rail plays a central role in the future of American transportation.
This morning I joined @GStephanopoulos on @ThisWeekABC to discuss Ukraine, the Congressional agenda and other news of the day. https://t.co/NStvgcMd3U

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law makes the largest investment in public transit in history: $39 billion to expand transit options across the country, replace old vehicles with zero-emission systems and improve accessibility for the elderly & those with disabilities.

With the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, @HouseDemocrats are creating good-paying jobs building a stronger foundation for economic growth for decades to come. In doing so, we’re giving communities across the country the tools to compete & succeed in the 21st Century Economy.

The House-passed #AmericaCOMPETES Act accelerates domestic manufacturing while ensuring that states can respond to public health emergencies like COVID-19 by authorizing grants to states to maintain or expand stockpiles of essential products such as PPE and medical equipment.
#January6th was an assault on our Capitol, our Congress and our democracy itself. Republicans may try to run, but they can't hide from the truth. https://t.co/qhy7De4lCV

Now, the Senate must join the House in standing up for human rights around the world and here at home by enacting not only the Global Respect Act, but the House-passed #EqualityAct as well. Read my full statement here: https://t.co/5hXzPjEt7g

The #GlobalRespectAct will help counter that injustice, barring offenders from entering the United States, gathering new data on anti-LGBTQ human rights violations and holding perpetrators accountable, including through additional sanctions.

Tragically, thousands of LGBTQ individuals are subjected to attack, harassment, arrest and murder every year, suffering under state-sanctioned discrimination and a surge of violence. Those responsible all too often act with impunity, never facing consequences for their crimes.

Today, the House took a bold step forward in protecting the fundamental rights of the global LGBTQ community. The bipartisan #GlobalRespectAct will ensure America offers no safe haven to those who violate the human rights of our LGBTQ family, friends & neighbors around the world.
Join me live at the U.S. Capitol for my weekly press conference. https://t.co/ak5LqFQ3Sn

With yesterday’s strong, bipartisan vote, the House sent a clear signal to survivors across our nation: you deserve the freedom to seek justice and be heard. Read my full statement here: https://t.co/6bJGpx4bQh

For too long, Americans who experience sexual harassment or assault in the workplace have been forced into the shadows by arbitration agreements protecting employers from liability & often shielding offenders from accountability. Employers prevail in more than 98% of these cases.

Last night, the House took a step to #EndForcedArbitration of sexual assault and harassment. Our bill will void agreements that silence 60 million workers and many more consumers who are currently denied the freedom to pursue recourse for sexual assault and harassment.

Many eligible families may be able to claim more money back on their tax returns thanks to the expanded Child Tax Credit from the #AmericanRescuePlan. To see if you’re eligible & ensure you get your full credit, visit the link here by April 18th. ➡️ https://t.co/H2fbzHvj1H

The House-passed #AmericaCOMPETES Act will elevate American leadership in the global arena — putting diplomacy first, strengthening our alliances, combatting unfair trade practices and standing up for our national values.

Tonight, I joined Members of Congress for a Moment of Silence to pay tribute to the more than 900,000 Americans tragically lost to COVID-19. In their memories, let us continue our work to bring an end to this pandemic. https://t.co/RFCAG1YAIW
Join @SenSchumer, bipartisan members of the House and Senate and me at the U.S Capitol to hold a Moment of Silence for the more than 900,000 American lives lost to COVID-19. https://t.co/ldoJw8oWIT

The @HouseDemocrats’ #AmericaCOMPETES Act passed by the House includes funding for the development of cutting-edge wireless and communications technology to ensure that America continues to outpace other countries and lead in technological developments in the 21st Century.

As we close this Gun Violence Survivors Week, let us hold in our hearts all those affected by the horrors of gun violence and renew our vow to end this scourge.
 
Together, we will continue to honor victims and survivors by turning our agony into action to #EndGunViolence.

See what happened behind-the-scenes around the United States Capitol with my Medium post, ‘Madam Speaker.’
https://t.co/gVJxHTieH2

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act invests in our alliances around the globe: strengthening our diplomatic partnerships, growing our economic footprint, restoring American leadership on climate and countering the influence of the Chinese government.

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act authorizes $3 billion for the construction and expansion of American solar manufacturing — reducing our reliance on foreign manufacturing while ensuring our electric grid is cleaner, more secure and resilient against cyberattacks.

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act invests $52 billion in chip manufacturing to create jobs for American workers and make these vital components in the U.S. — ensuring America is ahead of the world in technological development.

.@HouseDemocrats’ #AmericaCOMPETES Act helps to address supply chain disruptions while creating good-paying union jobs for American families with $52 billion in investments in facilities and equipment to produce American-made semiconductor chips.

Under the leadership of @POTUS and @HouseDemocrats, our nation will continue to #BuildBackBetter to create more good paying jobs and lower costs for families across America. Read my full statement here: https://t.co/wdxSDy5rRR

Today, the House will pass our #AmericaCOMPETES Act which will bring the manufacturing of critical goods, including semiconductor chips, back to our shores – while restoring American leadership in research and innovation and promoting American values on the world stage.

Now, @HouseDemocrats are prepared to build on this extraordinary economic momentum: continuing our work to lower families’ costs, strengthen our supply chains, and make more goods in America with the House passage of the #AmericaCOMPETES Act.

Today’s jobs report makes resoundingly clear that, with nearly half a million new jobs created last month and 6.6 million new jobs created in the last year, the economic recovery powered by @POTUS' leadership and @HouseDemocrats' economic plan continues to be historic.

Join the Committee Chairs and me for a press event on #AmericaCOMPETES, legislation that will supercharge domestic investment in chips, advance American manufacturing at home and strengthen global supply chains ahead of the House passage. https://t.co/EJf3UZ4xDc

Investing in science and innovation in America is an economic imperative.
 
The #AmericaCOMPETES Act from @HouseDemocrats makes significant investments in innovation and research, ensuring America's ability to lead the technologies and scientific discoveries of the future.

He fought for formerly enslaved Americans with major civil rights bills, fought to empower the federal government to protect families in the South from terrorist violence, and fought for human rights — from the poorest workers to immigrants to Native Americans and more.
Joseph Rainey was a brilliant orator, tireless legislator and patriotic leader – who should be known to all as a Founding Father who forever changed our nation.

Today, we paid tribute to the legacy of Representative Joseph Rainey of South Carolina, more than 150 years after he became our nation’s first Black Congressman. In affixing his name to Room H-150 in the United States Capitol, we help share his story. https://t.co/xRZCNYx9gj

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act introduced by the House will make transformational new investments in research, innovation and American manufacturing to ensure that America can outcompete any nation in the world.

Join @WhipClyburn, @SteveScalise, @RepBeatty, @RepTomRice and me at the U.S. Capitol for an event unveiling The Joseph H. Rainey Room dedicated to honor the life, career and legacy of our nation's first African American Member of Congress. https://t.co/yYNbtGvEdB
Join me live at the U.S. Capitol for my weekly press conference. https://t.co/VoXrqp7JAS

Congress remains ironclad in our commitment to our national security, and we will continue to work closely with the Administration to protect the American people. Read my full statement here:
https://t.co/huOuBWtjpR

On behalf of the Congress, I salute @POTUS’ strong leadership to keep our nation safe and secure. The death of Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Qurayshi is a strong step forward in the fight against ISIS, but the death of this ISIS leader does not mean the death of ISIS.

Last night, America delivered justice to the leader of ISIS and struck a serious blow to this terrorist group.  Our entire nation is grateful for the patriotism and dedication of our military personnel and intelligence community.

Join me live at a @CECCgov hearing ahead of the Beijing Olympics to give a platform to voices working on behalf of those abused & repressed by the CCP including civil society, human rights defenders, people of Hong Kong, Uyghurs & Tibetans. https://t.co/wQzSH1IxCN

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act accelerates the production of semiconductor chips, strengthens supply chains and increases research capacity in future technologies while protecting American workers from unfair competition and supporting American jobs and families right here at home.

As we continue to spread the word, @HouseDemocrats remain hard at work to help Build Back Better: with bigger paychecks, lower costs & lower taxes for families, while making the wealthiest Americans & the biggest corporations pay their fair share. https://t.co/K8Psv3ZgsM

.@HouseDemocrats are making clear that the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, under the leadership of @POTUS, creates millions of good-paying union jobs over the next decade: repairing roads & bridges, expanding broadband access, improving resilience to climate disaster & much more.

In the last two months, @HouseDemocrats barnstormed the nation to bring the good news of the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law to the American people. As of today, @HouseDemocrats have hosted more than 1,000 events across the country, highlighting how Democrats Deliver #ForThePeople.

Read my full statement with @RepBeatty, Chair of the Congressional Black Caucus, and @RepAdams, Founder and Co-Chair of the HBCU Caucus, here:
https://t.co/Af6RDfeCx0

It is even more shameful that these threats against HBCUs come during Black History Month, when we remember the violence against those fighting for civil & voting rights. Terrorism & racism have no place anywhere in our country. We must end these threats.

Recent bomb threats on Historically Black College and University campuses are horrifying and alarming. Along with @RepBeatty and @RepAdams, I am calling for a swift response from law enforcement agencies to prosecute these threats to the fullest extent of the law.

As we march forward in building a stronger, fairer future for our children and grandchildren, may this month serve as a reminder of the hard-fought progress of our past and of the urgent tasks that lie ahead. Read my full statement here:
https://t.co/6Mnib0Qgja

We are also fighting to build a more just economy, creating good-paying jobs & delivering long-overdue investments for every family – especially in long underserved communities – through implementation of the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law & enactment of the #BuildBackBetter Act.

.@HouseDemocrats are working to protect and expand the sacred right to vote with our Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act, and we have fought to save lives with our George Floyd Justice in Policing Act and will not rest until we achieve meaningful criminal justice reform.

Today our nation proudly sees Black representation at the highest levels of our government, from a record number of Black Members legislating in the Congress to @VP leading in the Administration to @POTUS’s decision to nominate a Black woman to the Supreme Court.

As we remember with open eyes the injustices of the past, we also recognize the inequities of the present — from the scourges of systemic racism and police violence to the plights of economic inequality and health disparity, which have been exacerbated by the pandemic.
This month and every #BlackHistoryMonth, America celebrates the resilient leadership, determined advocacy and unrelenting courage that the Black community has brought to our history and democracy.

It is wonderful that this year, thanks to the life-saving vaccines, many San Franciscans and Americans across the country can once again safely gather to celebrate the Lunar New Year and the joyful promise it brings. Read my full statement here:
https://t.co/otKePnfQV6

@HouseDemocrats have led the charge to enact @RepGraceMeng's COVID-19 Hate Crimes Act, which has helped to combat anti-AAPI violence while empowering communities, raising awareness & creating a position at the Department of Justice to expedite the review of COVID-19 hate crimes.

Home to one of the largest & most diverse AAPI communities in the country, San Francisco has long been proof that the beauty is in the mix. Yet, in our City & across the country, our AAPI family, friends & neighbors have experienced a surge of violence over the last two years.

Today, Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders across our country and communities around the globe mark the beginning of the Lunar New Year: a beautiful time of celebration, reflection and renewed optimism for the future.

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act is another action taken by @HouseDemocrats For The Children by:

- Supporting research & development for K-12 STEM education
- Improving STEM education and training
- Supporting the next generation of diverse STEM teachers, researchers & scientists

Today is the last day to #GetCovered California and join the record 1.8 million Californians who signed up for affordable health coverage through the exchange this enrollment period. Check out this site for plans, pricing and to get started. ➡ https://t.co/73q5qFKGZZ

Right now, the Chinese government's unfair, inhumane, anti-free market trade practices rig the global economy against American workers. With #AmericaCOMPETES, we're taking strong action to combat unfair trade practices and support American workers & domestic manufacturing.

When the @49ers take down the @RamsNFL today, the best team in the league will be crowned NFC champions, claim our rightful place in the Super Bowl and turn LA’s SoFi stadium red and gold.

Let’s go 49ers Faithful! #FTTB #SFvsLAR

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act includes another strong step by @HouseDemocrats to improve supply chains, prevent shortages of goods and combat unfair trade practices with $45 billion to strengthen our economy and ensure critical goods are made right here in the United States.

Yesterday, I joined colleagues @RepSpeier & @RepAnnaEshoo at Harvey Milk Terminal 1 to discuss how the bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act will deliver for the San Francisco International Airport, creating of thousands of good-paying union jobs for decades to come. https://t.co/eT9aVpQe1p

Join @RepSpeier, @RepAnnaEshoo, Airport Director Ivar Satero, local leaders & me at an event highlighting the $25 billion in aviation infrastructure investments in the bipartisan Infrastructure Investments & Jobs Act, including $250 million for @FlySFO. https://t.co/VUeoV7ov7l

Congress and the Country look forward to President Biden’s historic nomination, who will carry on Justice Breyer’s mission and who will keep faith with the Supreme Court’s role as a defender of individual rights. Read my full statement here:
https://t.co/H1Y9K9IEtK

For his legal brilliance, his unwavering integrity and his firm devotion to safeguarding our democracy, Justice Breyer will leave a remarkable legacy. We thank the Breyer family for sharing him with the Country.

Justice Breyer has championed liberty not merely as freedom from oppression, but as freedom to participate in our democracy – paving the way for great progress in our nation. Justice Breyer has helped ensure that our democracy does, as our Founders intended, work For The People.

When Justice Stephen Breyer departs from the bench, the Supreme Court and the Country will lose a leader of honor and integrity, a defender of liberty, justice and the Constitution, and a guardian of our fundamental rights.

Today, on #InternationalHolocaustRemembranceDay & the anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz-Birkenau, it is our solemn responsibility to honor all victims & rededicate ourselves to our sacred duty to confront rising antisemitism & Holocaust denial everywhere. Never Again.

Alongside President Biden, Democrats remain hard at work to extend our historic recovery while building a 21st Century American economy that can out-compete any nation on earth. Read my full statement here: https://t.co/Wv0tXc5IER

We must build on this strong economic momentum by creating jobs, lowering costs and untangling supply chains. @HouseDemocrats unveiled our #AmericaCOMPETES Act: bold, results-oriented legislation that will strengthen American leadership and competitiveness at home and abroad.

Last year was also the single greatest year of job growth in American history – creating 6.4 million jobs. Americans are finding new jobs at a record pace, starting new small businesses, sending their children safely back to school and so much more.
Today’s GDP numbers show that America had the fastest economic growth in nearly four decades, powered by @HouseDemocrats’ American Rescue Plan and @POTUS Biden’s leadership. https://t.co/tNk5hTjWNu

Health care is a right, not a privilege. Democrats remain firmly committed to working toward this goal as we strive to bring down health care costs and prescription drug prices for workers, seniors and families across the country. Read my full statement:
https://t.co/ttKUdvHaFc

As we battle the virus, ensuring quality, affordable and accessible health coverage will continue to be as important as ever. In a number of states, health insurance exchanges remain open through the end of this month, so there is still time for many Americans to sign up.

The Affordable Care Act has served as a vital lifeline during the pandemic — and with our American Rescue Plan, Democrats dramatically lowered premiums so that millions are covered by a quality plan while saving families an average of $2,400.

The record-breaking 14.5 million ACA health insurance sign-ups since November 1st make crystal clear that, thanks to @POTUS Biden and @HouseDemocrats, health care is more affordable and accessible than ever.

Now is the time to recommit to boldly investing in our nation’s future, and to do so in a way that strengthens the supply chain, lowers costs and ensures that America can out-compete any nation, today and for decades to come. Read my full statement here: https://t.co/QEMfv7DmIB

Major components of this package have already passed the House with overwhelmingly bipartisan votes. The #AmericaCOMPETES Act reflects a whole-of-House effort to produce a historic bill that will be most effective at strengthening our competitiveness at home and abroad.

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act will supercharge our investment in CHIPS, advance manufacturing at home, strengthen our supply chain, transform our research capacity and advance our competitiveness and leadership abroad, plus many other key provisions.

Today, the House takes action to transport our nation into the future, with the #AmericaCOMPETES Act: bold, results-oriented legislation that will strengthen America’s national and economic security and the financial security of families, and advance our leadership in the world. https://t.co/rGQHSadED1

With the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, Democrats have delivered #ForThePeople! These investments will create millions of good-paying, union jobs in communities across the country over the next decade rebuilding America’s infrastructure.

As our nation continues to battle the pandemic, Republicans must now abandon this sad stunt and join Democrats to crush the virus, grow our economy and bring down costs for families. Read my full statement here: https://t.co/lZJnSKHAJJ

Republicans have worked to recklessly endanger the health of colleagues, staffers and institutional workers. They do so with great shame and hypocrisy, as last year alone more than half of the Members of their conference designated a proxy so that they could vote remotely.
Both the Constitution and more than a century of legal precedent make clear that the House is empowered to determine its own rules – and remote voting by proxy falls squarely within this purview.
SCOTUS' refusal of @HouseGOP’s request to overturn the dismissal of their frivolous lawsuit to block remote voting by proxy is a victory for Congress, the rule of law and public health.

In @POTUS first year, Democrats delivered deeply needed relief to help support our heroic essential workers who have helped keep our communities running during this pandemic, from police officers and firefighters to transportation workers to teachers and more.

See what happened behind-the-scenes last week at the United States Capitol with my Medium post, ‘Madam Speaker.’
